net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.database.sqlitehouse

Interface SQLightable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Blargh, BorkBorkBork, Dargle, Fargle, Flargle, Quargle, Sparkle

    public interface SQLightable
    Designates a class as a data container which can be used in a database defined and managed by SQLiteHouse. This class must also be decorated by a SQLiteTable annotation which defines the attributes of that table. Implementation classes must also define a zero-argument constructor in order to be usable by SQLiteHouse.search(ROW) or SQLiteHouse.select(java.lang.Class<ROW>, long).
    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.1.4 (#26)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  SQLightable.Reflection<T extends SQLightable>
      A full reflection of a SQLightable object, which represents, and is used to marshal data for, an SQLite table.
      static class  SQLightable.ReflectionMap
      Provides a precise method for retrieving an entry from a map of schematic classes to their SQLightable.Reflection instances.
